title: Tunneling monster
data:
A **tunneling monster** is a [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") with the ability to bore tunnels through the normally solid [dungeon](/wiki/Dungeon "Dungeon"). Tunneling monsters can tunnel through rock and closed [doors](/wiki/Door "Door"), and chop down [trees](/wiki/Tree "Tree").

Some monsters can only tunnel through rock while wielding a [pick-axe](/wiki/Pick-axe "Pick-axe") or [dwarvish mattock](/wiki/Dwarvish_mattock "Dwarvish mattock"), and through trees while wielding an [axe](/wiki/Axe "Axe") or [battle-axe](/wiki/Battle-axe "Battle-axe"). Both picks and axes suffice for doors.

Note that *any* monster that can tunnel at all can go through both rock and wood. [Rock moles](/wiki/Rock_mole "Rock mole") can eat [trees](/wiki/Tree "Tree") and [woodchucks](/wiki/Woodchuck "Woodchuck") can apparently chuck rock.

No monster can tunnel through the specially designated [undiggable](/wiki/Undiggable "Undiggable") walls in some [special levels](/wiki/Special_levels "Special levels").

If you polymorph into a naturally tunneling monster you will gain the ability to tunnel without a pick. You will still be able to use a pick, provided your new form has hands and is strong enough to carry it. [Rock moles](/wiki/Rock_mole "Rock mole"), for instance, generally cannot even lift a [pick-axe](/wiki/Pick-axe "Pick-axe"). Your [digging](/wiki/Digging "Digging") is handled separately however, even while in polyform.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Effects](#Effects)

  - [1.1 Wall](#Wall)
  - [1.2 Solid rock](#Solid_rock)
  - [1.3 Tree](#Tree)
  - [1.4 Door](#Door)

- [2 Monsters capable of tunneling](#Monsters_capable_of_tunneling)

  - [2.1 Without a pick-axe or axe](#Without_a_pick-axe_or_axe)
  - [2.2 With a pick-axe or axe](#With_a_pick-axe_or_axe)

- [3 Messages](#Messages)

- [4 Technical details](#Technical_details)

- [5 See also](#See_also)

- [6 References](#References)

## Effects

### Wall

When a monster tunnels through a rock [wall](/wiki/Wall "Wall"), there is a 1⁄5 chance of producing the message "You hear crashing rock."[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

### Solid rock

When a monster tunnels through [solid rock](/wiki/Solid_rock "Solid rock") (the blank areas surrounding most of the dungeon), there is a 1⁄3 chance of some waste being produced. 1⁄4 of the time this waste will be a [boulder](/wiki/Boulder "Boulder"), the rest of the time it will be a single [rock](/wiki/Rock "Rock"). No message is produced.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)

### Tree

When a monster tunnels through a [tree](/wiki/Tree "Tree"), there is a 1⁄3 chance of a random piece of fruit being produced, chosen from [apple](/wiki/Apple "Apple"), [orange](/wiki/Orange "Orange"), [pear](/wiki/Pear "Pear"), [banana](/wiki/Banana "Banana"), and [eucalyptus leaf](/wiki/Eucalyptus_leaf "Eucalyptus leaf"). No message is produced.[\[4\]](#cite_note-4)

### Door

When a monster tunnels through a closed [door](/wiki/Door "Door"), there is a 1⁄3 chance of producing the message "You feel an unexpected draft."[\[5\]](#cite_note-5)

## Monsters capable of tunneling

### Without a pick-axe or axe

- r [rock mole](/wiki/Rock_mole "Rock mole")
- r [woodchuck](/wiki/Woodchuck "Woodchuck")
- U [umber hulk](/wiki/Umber_hulk "Umber hulk")

### With a pick-axe or axe

- Dwarves:

  - h [dwarf](/wiki/Dwarf_\(monster\) "Dwarf (monster)")
  - h [dwarf lord](/wiki/Dwarf_lord "Dwarf lord")
  - h [dwarf king](/wiki/Dwarf_king "Dwarf king")

- Archeologist related:

  - @ [student](/wiki/Student "Student")
  - @ [archeologist](/wiki/Archeologist_\(player_monster\) "Archeologist (player monster)")
  - @ [Lord Carnarvon](/wiki/Lord_Carnarvon "Lord Carnarvon")

## Messages

- You hear crashing rock.

  Produced 1⁄5 of the time when a monster tunnels through a rock [wall](/wiki/Wall "Wall").

- You feel an unexpected draft.

  Produced 1⁄3 of the time when a monster tunnels through a [door](/wiki/Door "Door").

- \<Monster> digs in.

  Produced when a pet umber hulk, woodchuck, or rock mole eats something off the ground in your sight. This [YAFM](/wiki/YAFM "YAFM") replaces the ordinary pet eating message.[\[6\]](#cite_note-6)

## Technical details

Monsters that can tunnel have the [M1\_TUNNEL](/wiki/M1_TUNNEL "M1 TUNNEL") monster attribute. Monsters that require picks and axes also have the [M1\_NEEDPICK](/wiki/M1_NEEDPICK "M1 NEEDPICK") monster attribute in addition to M1\_TUNNEL. No monster in vanilla [NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack") has M1\_NEEDPICK but not M1\_TUNNEL.

## See also

- [m\_move](/wiki/Source:Monmove.c#m_move "Source:Monmove.c") in [monmove.c](/wiki/Source:Monmove.c "Source:Monmove.c") – decides when and if monsters can and will tunnel.
- [mdig\_tunnel](/wiki/Source:Dig.c#mdig_tunnel "Source:Dig.c") in [dig.c](/wiki/Source:Dig.c "Source:Dig.c") – performs the tunneling. Called by m\_move.

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [dig.c in NetHack 3.6.0, line 1286](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.0_Release/dig.c#L1286)
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [dig.c in NetHack 3.6.0, line 1244](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.0_Release/dig.c#L1244)
3. [↑](#cite_ref-3) [dig.c in NetHack 3.6.0, line 1305](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.0_Release/dig.c#L1305)
4. [↑](#cite_ref-4) [src/dig.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1321](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/dig.c#L1321)
5. [↑](#cite_ref-5) [dig.c in NetHack 3.6.0, line 1250](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.0_Release/dig.c#L1250)
6. [↑](#cite_ref-6) [dogmove.c in NetHack 3.6.0, line 271](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.0_Release/dogmove.c#L271)

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.0. Click here for more information.](/images/d/d6/Nh360-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.0. Click here for more information.")

It may contain text specific to [NetHack 3.6.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.6.0 "NetHack 3.6.0"). Information on this page may be out of date.

html:
Tunneling monster

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

A tunneling monster is a monster with the ability to bore tunnels through the normally solid dungeon. Tunneling monsters can tunnel through rock and closed doors, and chop down trees.

Some monsters can only tunnel through rock while wielding a pick-axe or dwarvish mattock, and through trees while wielding an axe or battle-axe. Both picks and axes suffice for doors.

Note that any monster that can tunnel at all can go through both rock and wood. Rock moles can eat trees and woodchucks can apparently chuck rock.

No monster can tunnel through the specially designated undiggable walls in some special levels.

If you polymorph into a naturally tunneling monster you will gain the ability to tunnel without a pick. You will still be able to use a pick, provided your new form has hands and is strong enough to carry it. Rock moles, for instance, generally cannot even lift a pick-axe. Your digging is handled separately however, even while in polyform.

Contents

  • 1 Effects
    • 1.1 Wall
    • 1.2 Solid rock
    • 1.3 Tree
    • 1.4 Door
  • 2 Monsters capable of tunneling
    • 2.1 Without a pick-axe or axe
    • 2.2 With a pick-axe or axe
  • 3 Messages
  • 4 Technical details
  • 5 See also
  • 6 References

Effects

Wall

When a monster tunnels through a rock wall, there is a 1⁄5 chance of producing the message "You hear crashing rock."[1]

Solid rock

When a monster tunnels through solid rock (the blank areas surrounding most of the dungeon), there is a 1⁄3 chance of some waste being produced. 1⁄4 of the time this waste will be a boulder, the rest of the time it will be a single rock. No message is produced.[2][3]

Tree

When a monster tunnels through a tree, there is a 1⁄3 chance of a random piece of fruit being produced, chosen from apple, orange, pear, banana, and eucalyptus leaf. No message is produced.[4]

Door

When a monster tunnels through a closed door, there is a 1⁄3 chance of producing the message "You feel an unexpected draft."[5]

Monsters capable of tunneling

Without a pick-axe or axe

  • r rock mole
  • r woodchuck
  • U umber hulk

With a pick-axe or axe

  • Dwarves:
    • h dwarf
    • h dwarf lord
    • h dwarf king
  • Archeologist related:
    • @ student
    • @ archeologist
    • @ Lord Carnarvon

Messages

You hear crashing rock.
Produced 1⁄5 of the time when a monster tunnels through a rock wall.
You feel an unexpected draft.
Produced 1⁄3 of the time when a monster tunnels through a door.
<Monster> digs in.
Produced when a pet umber hulk, woodchuck, or rock mole eats something off the ground in your sight. This YAFM replaces the ordinary pet eating message.[6]

Technical details

Monsters that can tunnel have the M1_TUNNEL monster attribute. Monsters that require picks and axes also have the M1_NEEDPICK monster attribute in addition to M1_TUNNEL. No monster in vanilla NetHack has M1_NEEDPICK but not M1_TUNNEL.

See also

  • m_move in monmove.c – decides when and if monsters can and will tunnel.
  • mdig_tunnel in dig.c – performs the tunneling. Called by m_move.

References

  1. ↑ dig.c in NetHack 3.6.0, line 1286
  2. ↑ dig.c in NetHack 3.6.0, line 1244
  3. ↑ dig.c in NetHack 3.6.0, line 1305
  4. ↑ src/dig.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1321
  5. ↑ dig.c in NetHack 3.6.0, line 1250
  6. ↑ dogmove.c in NetHack 3.6.0, line 271

This page may need to be updated for the current version of NetHack.

It may contain text specific to NetHack 3.6.0. Information on this page may be out of date.
